result.execSummary:
All charges against Jviawn D Roach in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jviawn D Roach is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jviawn D Roach

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jviawn D Roach in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jviawn D Roach appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

ADDRESS INFO for Jviawn D Roach
Current: 3023 Old Almonte Dr., San Antonio, TX 78224   (Effective: 07-22-2022)
Prior: 3737 North 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-24-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Oral No Contact Order with CMS expect for purposes of child exchange and communication of child.

Defendant Jviawn D Roach in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/22/2022@230p
